auto_merge.commit_message:
Problem:  ext_messages cannot tell when the screen was cleared, which is
          needed to clear visible messages. An empty message is also
          never emitted, but clears messages from the message grid.
Solution: Repurpose the "msg_clear" event to be emitted when the screen
          was cleared. Emit an empty message with the `empty` kind to
          hint to a UI to clear the cmdline area.
auto_merge.commit_title: feat(ui): emit "msg_clear" event after clearing the screen (#34035)

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:  ext_messages cannot tell when the screen was cleared, which is
          needed to clear visible messages. An empty message is also
          never emitted, but clears messages from the message grid.
Solution: Repurpose the "msg_clear" event to be emitted when the screen
          was cleared. Emit an empty message with the `empty` kind to
          hint to a UI to clear the cmdline area.

Fix #33844
Fix #34007

comment_data.body:
Previously, msg_clear was like an directive to UIs that they should clear the screen, right? Is that still the case? 

The changed wording (and the news item) sound like it changed from a directive to an advisory hint.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -872,8 +875,9 @@ must handle.
 	    rather than started on a new line. Is set for |:echon|.
 
 ["msg_clear"] ~
-	Clear all messages currently displayed by "msg_show". (Messages sent
-	by other "msg_" events below will not be affected).
+	Clear all messages currently displayed by "msg_show", emitted after
+	clearing the screen (messages sent by other "msg_" events below should

comment_data.body: does ui.txt need to mention this new arg ?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -164,7 +164,7 @@ void wildmenu_hide(void)
 
 void msg_show(String kind, Array content, Boolean replace_last, Boolean history, Boolean append)
   FUNC_API_SINCE(6) FUNC_API_FAST FUNC_API_REMOTE_ONLY;
-void msg_clear(void)
+void msg_clear(String reason)

@@ -164,7 +164,7 @@ void wildmenu_hide(void)
 
 void msg_show(String kind, Array content, Boolean replace_last, Boolean history, Boolean append)
   FUNC_API_SINCE(6) FUNC_API_FAST FUNC_API_REMOTE_ONLY;
-void msg_clear(void)
+void msg_clear(String reason)

comment_data.body: Previously (before #27963), msg_clear was emitted after the internal tracking of visible messages was cleared. Now we no longer do that it indeed just serves as a hint after the screen itself was cleared.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -872,8 +875,9 @@ must handle.
 	    rather than started on a new line. Is set for |:echon|.
 
 ["msg_clear"] ~
-	Clear all messages currently displayed by "msg_show". (Messages sent
-	by other "msg_" events below will not be affected).
+	Clear all messages currently displayed by "msg_show", emitted after
+	clearing the screen (messages sent by other "msg_" events below should

comment_data.body: Isn't it unsafe to call UI events here? #28578

Currently all msg_show events are executed in |api-fast| context, so whether this callsite is unsafe should be irrelevant, as the callback can only schedule API calls.

Though I think we may need to lift the fast restriction for messages emitted by API calls, to maintain backward compatibility with some plugins that "stream" messages in a single event loop iteration (like in #36243). The original restriction was mostly put in place to avoid issues with internal messages.

comment_regular_data.body:
Hope to resolve #33844 and #34007 here but there are some things yet unresolved:

- Nvim's internal `msg_ext_visible` counter may prevent this event from emitting due to it getting out of sync after extui dismisses the hit-enter message. It's reset to 0 while our (or any) extui may still be showing messages (related #27963).
- To resolve #34007 we would also have to emit this event (perhaps with another boolean indicating the source) when `msg_clr_eos_force()` is called, rather than just returning with `ext_messages` enabled.

Went through a couple variations of this to resolve #34007. Settled on just emitting an empty `msg_show` event rather than `msg_clear(reason)`. I think just emitting an empty message event should be OK. The others were a bit difficult to document/reason about. I don't think it would make sense for `:echo ""` to clear message from a dedicated message window, just the cmdline. So a more ambiguous event seems desirable.

title: feat(ui): emit "msg_clear" event after clearing the screen
